body: Would you like to visualize your data?
name: Start

body: Do you have tabular data?
name: visualize

body: Do you want your chart to be fancy? Remember, this in NOT fancy, it's forbidden
name: tabular data

body: Ouch, good luck with that!
name: no tabular data

body: Do you want your chart to be accurate?
name: fancy

body: Do you want your chart to be accurate?
name: no fancy

body: Do you have several places names or addresses in your dataset?
name: accurate

body: I can't help you to make a good visualisation, but you can apply for a job at @FoxNews
name: no accurate

body: Line chart is what you need!
name: more 5

body: Do you have long label names?
name: long labels?

body: Do you want to compare values for different categories?
name: no places

body: Do you have several values for each category?
name: categories

body: Do you want to compare value changes over a period of time?
name: no categories

body: Do you want to compare value changes over a period of time?
name: several values

body: You should use a network visualization!
name: relationships analysis

body: That sounds complicated. You should ask for help to a human at @jplusplus_ :)
name: no relationships analysis

body: Is it readable?
name: more 20

body: Does your dataset contain more than 5 columns or lines?
name: period of time

body: Do you want to make a relationship analysis?
name: no period of time

body: Horizontal bar chart is what you need!
name: long label

body: Vertical bar chart is what you need!
name: no long label

body: Does your data contain more than 20 columns or lines?
name: no several values

body: We can't help you! Come back after you've read this https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misleading_graphs
name: readable

body: Yes indeed! I advise you to use an horizontal bar chart.
name: no readable

body: Do you have points or territories in your dataset?
name: population density

body: You should avoid maps then. Does your data contain more than 20 columns or lines?
name: no population density

body: Is the unit of your data percent?
name: percent?

body: Are you familiar with the population density in your data?
name: no percent

body: You should use a choropleth map!
name: percent

body: You should use a choropleth map!
name: territories

body: Do you have a numerical value associated to each location?
name: points

body: You should use a bubble map!
name: numerical points

body: You should use a point markers map!
name: no numerical points

body: You should use multiple lines chart!
name: multiple line chart

body: Do you have long label names?
name: horizontal stacked chart labels?

body: Stacked vertical bar chart is what you need!
name: vertical stacked chart

body: Stacked horizontal bar chart is what you need!
name: horizontal stacked chart labels
